Belgium France The Netherlands United Kingdom "Buzzer: " "Haptic: " "Visual: " "Voice: " Active Inactive Initialise communication Config Auto Ask address Miss config Exis config Send setup Send JSON Setup Start stream Stop stream Request JSON Setup Start measurement Stop measurement Send measurement list "\uD83D\uDD12" TCP service is started TCP service is stopped USB service is started USB service is stopped General USB service TCP service Sort Select the sorting order Ascending Descending Select how to sort the list Measurement ID Start time Setup ID Instrument ID Name Instrument Type ID Questionnaire ID Title Website Version Locale Changelog Version 0.12
02/08/2021
- The IP address for the TCP connection is now dynamically resolved from the URL
- Migrated to a new PDF library, which results in faster creation, smaller file sizes, no corrupt characters, better image quality...
- Made some changes to the body chart, unifying the drawn paths across devices, both in-app and in generated PDF files

Version 0.11
12/07/2021
- Enabled the filter on questionnaire option in the submitted questionnaires list
- Solved a bug where users with old data in SharedPreferences would sometimes experience a crash
- Removed unused code, resources, images...

Version 0.10
25/06/2021
- Added support for 100 Hz instruments to the graphs

Version 0.9
08/06/2021
- Fixed a bug that occurred while creating a new setup from an other locked setup
- Fixed a crash that occurred very occasionally while in the Graphs screen
- Enabled the filter on questionnaire option in the submitted questionnaires list
- Added new data types for full IMU data and full IMU data at 100 Hz

Version 0.8
31/05/2021
- Simplified and streamlined the UI of the USB Activity
- Set RTC time is added to the communication with the DCU

Version 0.7
19/05/2021
- Fixed a crash that occurred very occasionally when trying to show a dialog for an Activity that was already finished
- Fixed a bug in the exporting of the log files resulting in empty log files
- Fixed an app crash caused by a String that was nullified while communicating with the DMU

Version 0.6
11/05/2021
- Partly fixed an issue where special characters were replaced by question marks in the generated PDF files
- It is now possible to add clickable hyperlinks in the question tooltips
- Optimized the new logging method
- Added the option to use a locked setup as template to create a new setup

Version 0.5
27/04/2021
- Updated the creation process of PDF files to comply with the new Google Play Policy
- Updated the logging method to comply with the new Google Play Policy

Version 0.4
26/03/2021
- Made some changes to the accessible parts of the app based on permissions of the user
- Fixed a bug where the progress dialog could get stuck on screen while creating the PDF
- Fixed some progress dialog messages where the ellipsis was displayed incorrectly
- Fixed a bug where the app would crash while parsing a setup without the instrument type and instrument parameter lists

Version 0.3
23/02/2021
- Fixed a bug where some users would be logged out automatically under certain circumstances

Version 0.2
27/01/2021
- Solved a bug that would result in multiple instances of the USB communication service causing problems with transferring the data to the database
- Made some small changes to the (submitted) questionnaire formatting
- The (general) notice is displayed only once now
- Added sorting options to the questionnaires list
- Added the option to submit a questionnaire for an other user
- Fixed a bug causing the app to crash when a submitted questionnaire with a specific answer type was opened

Version 0.1
01/10/2020
- Initial release
Please agree to the terms and conditions listed below Privacy policy

The NOMADe project team attaches a high importance on data protection, and on compliance with the GDPR. For additional information and remarks on data protection and GDPR compliance, please contact a project partner. The aim of this privacy notice is to outline how we will collect and use information during our project activities and by our forms.

Information Collection

The NOMADe project team collects information through its forms at several stages (registration forms, expression of interest forms, post-event evaluation forms, etc.) and through its experiments and dedicated questionnaires.

Information Provided by You

In general, we collect the following information: names, telephone numbers, addresses, email addresses, geographical locations, company name, etc. We may also collect medical information which will be saved in an anonymized database.

Information Usage

Primary Use of Personal Information

The information collected by the NOMADe project team will be used for event administration and for maintaining an up to date contact database.

The information which you give will be used for the following purposes: to enable the project team to create a computer and paper record of your participation in NOMADe and its related activities, and to enable the project team to compile statistics. No information that would identify you as an individual will be published without your prior agreement. The information will be kept securely, and will be kept no longer than necessary.

Secondary Use of Personal Information

Registered participants to the NOMADe project and any NOMADe related activities may receive additional communications from us about NOMADe support services, newsletters, etc. Anyone wishing to no longer receive any information must notify a project partner to be removed from any contact lists.

Use of Information gathered during Experiments and Dedicated Questionnaires

This information is always saved and treated in an anonymized way. Only generalized conclusions will be published.

Sharing Data with Third Parties

We may share personal information data with the following institutions, partners in the NOMADe project: Catholic University Leuven, University of Antwerp, CeREF, University of Mons, University of Lille, University of Picardy Jules Verne, Polytechnic University of Hauts-de-France and University of Reims Champagne-Ardenne.

Links from our Websites

We offer links to other websites. Please note: when you click on links to other websites, we encourage you to read their privacy policies. Their standards may differ from ours.

Use of pictures and videos

Occasionally, pictures and videos taken during project activities will be used in the communication activities of the project.
